revised_title: Advancements in Radio Interferometer Technology for Observing Weak Radio Stars
tldr: The authors developed a new radio interferometer system that significantly improves the sensitivity and accuracy of observing weak radio stars. This system allows for better detection and location of radio stars, as well as the measurement of their angular diameter and polarization. The new interferometer has been used on various wavelengths to study radio stars and the radiation from the sun, leading to important advancements in radio astronomy.
